data.q: Which Python module is used to work with SQLite databases by default?
data.e: sqlite3 is included in Pythonâ€™s standard library and provides built-in SQLite support.

data.q: Which statement is true about SQLite?
o: It requires a separate server process
It stores data in memory only
data.e: SQLite stores the entire database in a single file and does not require a server.

data.q: Which Python package is commonly used to connect to MySQL?
data.e: mysql.connector is an official MySQL driver provided for Python.

data.q: How do you establish a database connection using sqlite3?
data.e: sqlite3.connect() opens a connection to the specified SQLite database file.

data.q: Which method is used to execute SQL statements in Python DB-API?
data.e: The execute() method is used to run SQL queries through a cursor.

data.q: Why should parameterized queries be used?
data.e: Parameterized queries protect against SQL injection attacks by separating data from SQL logic.

data.q: Which placeholder style is used by sqlite3 in Python?
data.e: sqlite3 uses question mark (?) placeholders for parameter substitution.

data.q: Which command is used to commit changes to the database?
data.e: commit() saves all pending transactions to the database.

data.q: What happens if commit() is not called after INSERT or UPDATE?
o: Changes are rolled back on connection close
data.e: Without commit(), changes are not persisted and may be rolled back.

data.q: Which method is used to fetch all rows from a query result?
data.e: fetchall() retrieves all remaining rows from the result set.
